events.title: Black Thursday Stock Market Crash
events.description: The New York Stock Exchange experienced a severe crash on Black Thursday, marking the beginning of the Great Depression.
events.significance: This event triggered a worldwide economic downturn, leading to widespread unemployment and poverty throughout the 1930s.

events.title: United Nations Founded
events.description: The United Nations officially came into existence as a global organization dedicated to promoting peace and cooperation after World War II.
events.significance: The UN has played a crucial role in international diplomacy, peacekeeping, and addressing global issues since its founding.

events.title: Cuban Missile Crisis Ends
events.description: The Soviet Union agreed to remove missiles from Cuba, ending a tense 13-day confrontation with the United States that brought the world close to nuclear war.
events.significance: This resolution helped to prevent nuclear war and led to improved communication between the US and Soviet Union.

events.title: Balfour Declaration Presented to British Cabinet
events.description: The British government expressed support for the establishment of a 'national home for the Jewish people' in Palestine.
events.significance: This declaration significantly influenced the course of Middle Eastern history and the eventual creation of the State of Israel.
